docs.title: Cookbook
docs.text:
Each recipe is a markdown file with three sections:

  1. Ingredients as shopping list with sections for:
    • Produce
    • Dairy
    • Middle
    • Staples - Check pantry
  2. Ingredients as a prep list
  3. Cooking instructions
  4. Notes (e.g., prep time)
  5. Citation

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Onion (2)
    • Mushrooms
    • Garlic cloves (2)
    • Cilantro (1/4 c)
  • Middle
    • Black beans (30 oz)
    • Hamburger buns
  • Dairy
    • Eggs (2)
    • Pepper jack cheese slices
  • Staples
    • Pickles
    • Ketchup (2 tbsp)
    • Worcestershire sauce (2 tsp)
    • Hot sauce (1/2 tsp)
    • BBQ sauce (2 tbsp)
    • Salt (3/4 tsp)
    • Black pepper (1/2 tsp)
    • Cumin (1 tsp)
    • Chili powder (1 tsp)
    • Smoked paprika (1 tsp)
    • Breadcrumbs (1/2 c)
    • Olive oil (1 tbsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Drain and rinse black beans.
  2. Carmelize 1 onion
  3. Prep pan fry mushrooms
  4. Aromatics
    • Finely chop 1 onion
    • Press 2 garlic cloves
  5. Bowl, mix
    • 2 eggs
    • 2 tbsp ketchup
    • 2 tsp Worcestershire sauce
    • 1/2 tsp hot sauce
    • 2 tbsp BBQ sauce
    • 3/4 tsp salt
    • 1/2 tsp black pepper
    • 1 tsp cumin
    • 1 tsp chili powder
    • 1 tsp smoked paprika
    • 1/2 c breadcrumbs

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 325
  2. Spread beans on sheet, bake 15m to dry
  3. For onion, garlic
    1. Pan fry until softened, 5-6m.
    2. Blot dry
    3. Add to bowl
  4. Form the into 6 patties.
  5. Oven to 400
  6. Bake for 10 minutes on each side.
  7. Add Cheese, continue bake
  8. Serve

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 45m
    • Prep: 30m
    • Cook: 15m
  • Servings: 6

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspried by Sally's Baking Addiction.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Broccoli (2 heads)
    • Yellow onion (1)
    • Garlic (2)
    • Fresh thyme (1 tbsp)
  • Dairy
    • Unsalted butter (6 tbsp)
    • Milk (1.5 c)
    • Cheddar cheese (8 oz)
  • Staples
    • All-purpose flour (.25 c)
    • Panko breadcrumbs (1 c)
    • Nutmeg (1/4 tsp)
    • Salt and pepper

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Broccoli into bite-sized florets
  2. Finely chop 1 onion
  3. Press 2 garlic cloves
  4. Strip 1 tbsp fresh thyme.
  5. Shred 8 oz cheddar cheese.
  6. Measure
    • .25 c flour
    • 1.5 c milk
    • 1 c breadcrumbs

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Oven 400°F.
  2. Roast broccoli 20m
  3. In pan
    • melt 6 tbsp unsalted butter.
    • Whisk in 1/4 c all-purpose flour.
    • Pour in 1.5 c milk
    • bring to a simmer, stirring frequently until thickened.
  4. Off heat, add
    • Nutmeg (1/4 tsp)
    • Salt and pepper
    • .75 c cheddar cheese
    • 1.5 c milk
    • Broccoli
  5. Top with .75 c cheese, 1c breadcrumbs
  6. Reduce oven 350, Bake 25m

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 30 minutes
  • Servings: 6

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: This recipe was adapted from Cookie and Kate.

docs.title: Brussels
docs.text: Cut halves, coat olive oil/salt. Roast 425-450° 39m, cut down on sheet. Cook pancetta like pan bacon. Combine all in bowl, add parm.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Kale (8 oz)
  • Dairy
    • Sour Cream (4 tbsp)
  • Middle
    • Chicken Breast Strips (20 oz)
    • Tomato Paste (3 oz)
    • Coconut Milk (11 oz)
  • Staples
    • Basmati Rice (1 c)
    • Curry Powder (2 tbsp)
    • Paprika (2 teaspoons)
    • Chili Flakes (2 teaspoons)
    • Salt
    • Pepper
    • Vegetable Oil (2 tbsp)
    • Sugar (4 teaspoons)
    • Butter (2 tbsp)

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Cook 1c rice in a rice cooker.
  2. Kale: Wash, dry, derib.
  3. Chicken: Pat dry, season with salt and pepper.
  4. Measure Sour Cream (4 tbsp)
  5. Wet bowl:
    • Open coconut milk.
    • Sugar (4 teaspoons)
    • Butter (2 tbsp)
  6. Measure out spices.
    • Tomato Paste (3 oz)
    • Curry Powder (2 tbsp)
    • Paprika (2 teaspoons)
    • Chili Flakes (2 teaspoons)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Large pan, med-high heat.
    1. Add kale and season with salt and pepper.
    2. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender (5-7 min).
    3. Transfer to a plate.
  2. Same pan, med-high heat. Add chicken, til browned (4-6 min).
  3. Same pan, med heat.
    1. Add tomato paste, curry powder, paprika, spices.
    2. Cook, stirring, until chicken coated and spices are fragrant (1 min).
    3. Add coconut milk, .25 cup water, 2 teaspoons sugar, 1 tablespoon butter,
  4. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low (2-3 min)
  5. Add kale and sour cream (4 tbsp); stir to combine.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 25m
  • Servings: 4

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by HelloFresh.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Eggs (2)
    • Garlic (2)
    • Green onion (1)
    • Kale (1)
    • Lime (1)
    • Edamame (opt)
  • Dairy (none)
  • Middle (none)
  • Staples
    • high heat oil (2 tbsp)
    • misc chopped veg (opt)
    • sea salt
    • coconut flakes (.75 c)
    • brown rice (2 c)
    • soy sauce (2 tsp)
    • sriracha (2 tsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
NOTE: Cook rice ahead of time

  1. Cook/chill 2 cups brown rice
  2. Derib and chop kale
  3. Measure 3/4 cup coconut flakes
  4. Bowl: Wisk 2 eggs, dash salt
  5. Bowl aromatics
    1. Press 2 garlic
    2. Chop 3/4 cup green onion
    3. Chop 1 cup veg (opt)
  6. Bowl sauce
    1. Soy sauce (2 tsp)
    2. Sriacha (2 tsp)
    3. Juice of 1/2 lime

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Large pan
    • Med-high heat until water sizzles
    • 1 tsp oil
    • Pour in the eggs, stir frequently, scrambled and lightly set
    • Eggs to bowl
    • Wipe pan
  2. Same pan - 1 tbsp oil
    • Add galic/green onion, optional veg
    • Cook until fragrant or veg tender, stir frequently, 30s+
    • Add kale and dash salt, cook 1-2m unil tender
    • Transfer to bowl of eggs
  3. Same pan - 2 tsp oil
    • Add coconut flakes, cook until lightly golden, 30s+
    • Add rice, cook until hot, 3m
    • Pour bowl back into pan, break up eggs
    • Once warmed, remove from heat
  4. Same pan
    • Add soy, sriracha, lime juice
    • Stir to combine
    • Taste, add tamari or salt as needed
  5. Garnish with lime wedges, serve

docs.title: Notes

• Suggested Time: 35m

1. Chop and saute sausage
  2. Chop lettuce and tomato

docs.text: 1. Assemble

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Rainbow Plant Life

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Garlic (2)
    • Lemon (1)
    • Cucumber (1)
    • Tomato, roma
    • Jalapeno
    • Green onion (2)
  • Dairy
    • Eggs (1)
    • Parmesan (0.25 c)
    • Plain yogurt (1 c)
  • Middle
    • quinoa (0.5 c)
    • chickpeas (15 oz)
    • pita
  • Staples
    • ground cumin (0.5 tsp)
    • paprika (0.5 tsp)
    • salt and pepper
    • olive oil (2 tbsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
NOTE: Quinoa takes time

  1. Cook .5c quinoa
  2. Chickpeas, drain and rinse
  3. De-seed jalapeno

  4. In food processor

    • Jalapeno
    • 2 green onion

  5. 2 garlic

  6. Chickpeas

  7. 2c spinach

  8. Grate .25c parm

  9. 1 egg
  10. Spice mix
    • ground cumin (0.5 tsp)
    • paprika (0.5 tsp)
    • dash salt and pepper

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Food processor, pulse until fine chopped
    • 15oz chickpeas
    • 2c spinach
    • 2 garlic
  2. Add then pulse
    • quinoa
    • Parmesan
    • egg
    • spices
  3. Shape into 8 patties, pan fry 3-4m er side
  4. Serve with yogurt, lemon, pita, tomato, cucumber.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 35m
    • Prep: 20m
    • Cook: 15m
  • Servings: 2

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspried by Woman's Day.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce:
    • cherry tomatoes (2 c)
    • yellow squash (2 medium)
    • zucchini (1 medium)
    • fresh basil (1-2 tbsp)
    • lemon (1)
    • garlic (1)
  • Dairy:
    • butter (2 tbsp)
    • goat cheese (1 oz)
  • Middle:
    • whole grain pasta (.5 lb)
  • Staples:
    • olive oil (2 tbsp)
    • red pepper flakes
    • salt, pepper

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F and line a baking sheet.
  2. Prepare vegetables on sheet
    • cherry tomatoes
    • yellow squash + zucchini - quartered lengthwise, .5in slices
  3. Bowl:
    • Chiffon basil (1-2 tbsp)
    • lemon juice (2 tbsp)
    • goat cheese (1 oz) crumbled
    • butter (2 tbsp)
    • red pepper flakes

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Veg:
    1. Toss tomatoes, squash, and zucc w/olive oil, salt, and pepper.
    2. Roast for 25m at 400°F.
  2. Pasta:
    1. Cook pasta until al dente. Reserve 1c pasta water.
    2. Drain pasta and return to the pot.
  3. Combine in pot:
    1. Add bowl w/ lemon juice, butter, goat cheese, etc.
    2. Add .25c pasta water - or more
    3. Add roasted veg and juices to the pot.
    4. Toss to combine.
    5. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with basil.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 35m
    • Prep Time: 10m
    • Cook Time: 25m
  • Servings: 4

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: This recipe was inspired by Cookie and Kate.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • 2 sweet potatoes
    • 3–4c kale
    • 1 avocado
    • 1 apple (opt)
  • Dairy (none)
  • Middle
    • 2 blocks tempeh
    • 0.5c sauerkraut
    • dried cranberries (opt)
    • quinoa (opt)
    • crispy onions (opt)
    • pecans (opt)
  • Staples
    • 0.25c maple syrup
    • 0.25c stone ground mustard
    • 2tbsp soy sauce
    • 2tbsp olive oil

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Preheat the oven to 425.
  2. Mix dressing in big bowl
    • 0.25c maple syrup
    • 0.25c stone ground mustard
    • 2tbsp soy sauce
    • 2tbsp olive oil
  3. Open tempeh
    • drain liquid
    • marinate in half of dressing 30 min
  4. Prep veg (opt)
    • peel and dice sweet potatoes
    • cut kale into small pieces
    • cut optional apple into small pieces
  5. Set aside
    • 0.5c sauerkraut
    • 1 avocado
    • dried cranberries (opt)
    • quinoa (opt)
    • crispy onions (opt)
    • pecans (opt)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Baking sheet:
    • Tempeh
    • Sweet potatoes, with oil and salt
    • Roast 25–30 min
  2. Dressing bowl:
    • Kale into marination bowl
    • Add little more dressing and avocado
    • Massage
  3. Toss with other optional ingredients

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 50m
  • Servings: 4-6

docs.title: Citation

docs.title: Salad
docs.text:
• Produce:
    • purple cabbage (2 c)
    • carrot (1)
    • snow/sugar snap peas (1 c)
    • green onion (.25 c)
    • lime (1)
    • ginger (1 tsp)
  • Staples:
    • quinoa or millet (.75 c)
    • peanuts, roasted and salted (.25 c)
    • smooth peanut butter (.25 c)
    • soy sauce (3 tbsp)
    • maple syrup or honey (1 tbsp)
    • rice vinegar (1 tbsp)
    • (toasted) sesame oil (1 tsp)
    • red pepper flakes

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Cook .75c quinoa in a rice cooker w/1.5c water.
  2. Sauce. Wisk together (maybe nuke <30s)
    • smooth peanut butter (.25 c)
    • soy sauce (3 tbsp)
    • maple syrup or honey (1 tbsp)
    • rice vinegar (1 tbsp)
    • (toasted) sesame oil (1 tsp)
    • lime juice (.5 lime)
    • red pepper flakes
  3. Thinly slice, bowl
    • purple cabbage (2 c)
    • carrot (1 c)
    • snow/sugar snap peas (1 c)
    • green onion (.25 c)
    • peanuts (.25 c)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Cool cooked quinoa
  2. Combine

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 40m
    • Prep Time: 20m
    • Cook Time: 20m
  • Servings: 4

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: This recipe was inspired by Cookie and Kate.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce:
    • red onion (1 c)
    • red bell pepper (1)
    • broccoli (1 lb)
    • baby spinach (5 oz)
  • Middle:
    • tomato paste (2 tbsp)
    • vegetable broth (2 c)
    • black beans (15 oz)
    • 8 8" whole wheat tortillas
  • Dairy:
    • Monterey Jack cheese, shredded (1 c)
  • Staples:
    • olive oil (3 tbsp)
    • flour (3 tbsp)
    • ground chili powder (1 tbsp)
    • ground cumin (1 tsp)
    • garlic powder (0.5 tsp)
    • dried oregano (0.25 tsp)
    • salt/pepper
    • cinnamon, pinch (optional)
  • Staples:
    • olive oil (2 tbsp)
    • salt/pepper
    • cumin (1 tsp)
    • cinnamon (.25 tsp)

docs.title: Sauce
docs.text:
1. Measure sauce dry, small bowl.
    • flour (3 tbsp)
    • ground chili powder (1 tbsp)
    • ground cumin (1 tsp)
    • garlic powder (0.5 tsp)
    • dried oregano (0.25 tsp)
    • salt/pepper
  2. Measure? Sauce wet. Place near stove, seperate.
    • tomato paste (2 tbsp)
    • vegetable broth (2 c)
    • apple cider vinegar (1 tsp)

docs.title: Enchilada
docs.text:
1. Preheat 400, middle rack
  2. Grease 9x13 pan, w/ tortillas nearby
  3. Chop red onion (1 c)
  4. Chop same bowl: broc florettes (1), red bell pepper (1)
  5. Small dry:
    • cumin (1 tsp)
    • cinnamon (.25 tsp)
  6. Measure 5c spinach packed
  7. Shred cheese (1 c)
  8. Mixing bowl
    • Drained black beans
    • Cheese (.25 c)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Sauce:
    1. Warm oil in a pot over medium heat.
    2. Add flour/spices when sizzle on contact
    3. Whisk constantly for 1m until fragrant.
    4. Whisk in 2 tbsp tomato paste, then slowly pour in 2c broth.
    5. Heat to med-high, then gentle simmer 5-7m until thickened.
    6. Season salt/pepper
  2. Large skillet on medium w/ olive oil (2 tbsp)
    1. Cook onion 5-7m until translucent
    2. Add broc/bell pepper, 3-5m until tender
    3. Recuce to medium-low, cover, stir 8-9m until brown edges
    4. Add cumin/cinnamon, cook 30s
    5. Add spinach by handful, stir until wilted
    6. To bowl w/ beans/cheese
  3. Bowl: 2 tbsp sauce, stir
  4. Pan: 0.5 c sauce
  5. Assemble:
    1. Fill tortilla w/ .5c veg, roll, and place seam side down
    2. Drizzle remaining sauce/cheese.
  6. Bake 20 min mid rack
  7. Bake 3-6 min upper rack
  8. Rest 10 min

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Sauce:
    • Prep Time: 3m
    • Cook Time: 7m
    • Total Time: 10m
    • Yield: 2 c
  • Enchiladas:
    • Prep Time: 15m
    • Cook Time: 30m
    • Total Time: 45m
    • Yield: 4 servings
  • Total time: 60m

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: This recipe was inspired by Cookie and Kate's Enchilada Sauce and Vegetarian Enchiladas.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Lemon (1)
    • Garlic (4)
  • Dairy
  • Middle
    • nuts (1 c)
  • Staples
    • Grapeseed oil (.25 c)
    • Nutritional yeast (.25 c)
    • Liquid aminos (1 tbsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
NOTE: Pre-soak nuts >2h

  1. Soak 1c nuts
  2. Peel 4 garlic
  3. Measure
    • Grapeseed Oil .25c
    • Nutritional yeast .25c
    • Lemon juice .25c + .5 tbsp
    • Liquid aminos 1tbsp
  4. Spice mix
    • Salt 1 tsp
    • Garlic powder .5 tsp
    • Cumin .5 tsp
    • Cayenne dash

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. All ingredients to blender
  2. Airtight container overnight

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 10m
    • Prep: 10m
    • Cook: 0m
  • Servings: 8
  • Substitutions:
    • Almonds -> Cashews don't need soaking

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Blissful Basil

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Blueberries (1 c)
  • Dairy
    • Plain Yog (1 c)
    • Eggs (2)
  • Middle
  • Staples
    • Flour (1.8 c)
    • Baking powder (1 tsp)
    • Baking soda (.5 tsp)
    • Salt (.5 tsp)
    • Cinnamon (.25 tsp, opt)
    • Oil (.3 c)
    • Honey or maple syrup (.5 c)
    • Vanilla extract (2 tsp)
    • Sugar (1 tbsp)
    • Butter

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
NOTE: Let eggs to room temp

  1. Grease muffin tin w/butter
  2. Beat 2 eggs
  3. Dry 1:
    • Flour 1.75 c
    • Baking powder (1 tsp)
    • Baking soda (.5 tsp)
    • Salt (.5 tsp)
    • Cinnamon (.25 tsp, opt)
  4. Dry 2:
    • Blueberries
    • 1 tsp flour
  5. Wet 1:
    • Oil (.3 c)
    • Honey or maple syrup (.5 c)
  6. Wet 2:
    • Plain Yog (1 c)
    • Vanilla extract (2 tsp)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 400
  2. Bowl of oil, honey/maple
    1. Beat in eggs
    2. Add yogurt/vanilla
    3. Mix well
  3. Pour wet in dry
  4. Fold in blueberries
  5. Bake 16-19m

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 35m
    • Prep: 13m
    • Cook: 22m
  • Servings: 12

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Cookie and Kate
